entry.title: Testing push notifications for RSS 2
entry.summary: Today, Finance Minister, Bill Morneau, announced action to further ensure Canadians have access to personal protective equipment (PPE) and other necessary medical equipment.

entry.title: Minister Fortier highlights government support for businesses in virtual town hall with the Chamber of Commerce for Greater Moncton
entry.summary: Today, Minister of Middle Class Prosperity and Associate Minister of Finance Mona Fortier took part in a virtual town hall with the Chamber of Commerce for Greater Moncton. She discussed challenges facing New Brunswick businesses and pointed to the Government of Canada’s ongoing support for companies and workers through its COVID-19 Economic Response Plan.

entry.title: Government of Canada appoints Tiff Macklem as next Governor of the Bank of Canada
entry.summary: Today, Finance Minister, Bill Morneau, announced that Tiff Macklem will be appointed Governor of the Bank of Canada, effective June 3, 2020. Mr. Macklem will replace Stephen S. Poloz, who has led the Bank since 2013, and will be completing his seven-year term at its helm in early June.

entry.title: Minister Fortier Highlights Government Support for Businesses in Digital Town Hall with Workforce Windsor-Essex
entry.summary: Today, Minister Fortier continued to meet virtually with business associations across Canada. She participated in a digital town hall with Workforce Windsor-Essex, the fifth such outreach event in the last month.

entry.title: Minister Fortier Highlights Government Support for Businesses in Digital Town Hall with the Greater Sudbury Chamber of Commerce
entry.summary: Today, Minister Fortier continued to meet virtually with business associations across Canada. She participated in a digital town hall with the Greater Sudbury Chamber of Commerce, the fourth such outreach event in the last month.

entry.title: Minister Fortier Highlights Government Support for Businesses in Digital Town Hall with the Regina and District Chamber of Commerce
entry.summary: Today, Minister Fortier participated in a digital town hall with the Regina and District Chamber of Commerce to discuss challenges facing the region’s businesses and how the Government of Canada is delivering support through these difficult times with its COVID-19 Economic Response Plan.

entry.title: Minister Fortier Highlights Government Support for Businesses in Digital Town Hall with Richmond Chamber of Commerce
entry.summary: Today, Minister Fortier participated in a digital town hall with the Richmond Chamber of Commerce to discuss challenges facing the region’s businesses and how the Government of Canada is delivering support through these difficult times with its COVID-19 Economic Response Plan.

entry.title: Minister Morneau Concludes Productive G7, G20, IMF, and World Bank Meetings
entry.summary: Canada continues to engage and coordinate with international partners to take measures that safeguard public health and ensure economic stability.

entry.title: Government of Canada Clarifies Support for Canadian Journalism

entry.title: Minister Fortier Highlights Government Support for Businesses in Digital Town Hall with Tri-Cities Chamber of Commerce
entry.summary: Today, Minister Fortier took part in a digital town hall with the Tri-Cities Chamber of Commerce for Coquitlam, Port Coquitlam and Port Moody to discuss the challenges facing the region’s businesses and how the Government of Canada is supporting them through these difficult times with its COVID-19 Economic Response Plan.

entry.title: Minister Fortier Highlights Government Support for Franco-Ontarians and their Businesses in ONFR+ News Digital Town Hall
entry.summary: Today, the Honourable Mona Fortier, Minister of Middle Class Prosperity and Associate Minister of Finance, addressed a live digital town hall hosted by ONFR+ News to discuss the current challenges facing Franco-Ontarians and their businesses, and how the Government of Canada is supporting them through these challenges with its COVID-19 Economic Response Plan.

entry.title: Government announces relief for federally regulated pension plan sponsors
entry.summary: Finance Minister Bill Morneau today announced that the government will provide immediate, temporary relief to sponsors of federally regulated, defined benefit pension plans.

entry.title: Minister Fortier Highlights Government Support for Businesses at Ottawa Board of Trade
entry.summary: Today, Minister Fortier addressed the virtual town hall of the Ottawa Board of Trade to discuss the challenges facing Ottawa’s economy and to outline the Government of Canada’s COVID-19 Economic Response Plan, which is addressing the needs of Canadians and businesses during this time of global uncertainty.

entry.title: Minister Morneau to discuss global coordination at the G7, G20 and the Spring Meetings of the IMF and the World Bank
entry.summary: Canada is also working with international partners to discuss global economic and social stability, share information and best practices, and strengthen international coordination in response to the current crisis. In support of these efforts, Minister Morneau will attend the virtual meeting of the G7 Finance Ministers and Central Bank Governors today and the virtual meeting of the G20 Finance Ministers and Central Bank Governors tomorrow.

entry.title: COVID-19 Emergency Response Act, No. 2 receives Royal Assent to help businesses keep Canadians in their jobs
entry.summary: The Government of Canada is taking immediate, significant and decisive action to support Canadians and businesses facing hardship as a result of the COVID-19 global pandemic

entry.title: Government Introduces COVID-19 Emergency Response Act, No. 2 to Help Businesses Keep Canadians in their Jobs
entry.summary: The Government of Canada is taking immediate, significant and decisive action to support Canadians and businesses facing hardship as a result of the global COVID-19 outbreak.

entry.title: Minister Morneau and Minister Ng mark the launch of the Canada Emergency Business Account
entry.summary: Today, Finance Minister Bill Morneau and Mary Ng, Minister of Small Business, Export Promotion and International Trade, issued the following statement.

entry.title: Government provides further flexibility for employers to access the Canada Emergency Wage Subsidy
entry.summary: Today, Finance Minister Bill Morneau provided further details on the eligibility criteria for businesses to access the Canada Emergency Wage Subsidy (CEWS). These details will ensure that the proposed CEWS meets the government’s objective to support the employers that are hardest hit by the COVID-19 pandemic and protect the jobs Canadians depend on during these difficult times.

entry.title: Government Announces Details of the Canada Emergency Wage Subsidy to Help Businesses Keep Canadians in their jobs
entry.summary: To help Canadians and businesses get through these tough economic times, the Prime Minister, Justin Trudeau, announced that the Government is proposing to introduce a wage subsidy of 75 per cent for qualifying businesses, for up to 3 months, retroactive to March 15, 2020.

entry.title: Government announces support for air transportation sector during COVID-19 pandemic
entry.summary: Today, Finance Minister Bill Morneau announced that the government is waiving ground lease rents from March 2020 through to December 2020 for the 21 airport authorities that pay rent to the federal government.

entry.title: The COVID-19 Emergency Response Act Receives Royal Assent
entry.summary: The Government of Canada is taking strong, immediate and effective action to protect Canadians and our economy from the impacts of the global COVID-19 pandemic.

entry.title: Government introduces Canada Emergency Response Benefit to help workers and businesses
entry.summary: To support workers and help businesses keep their employees, the government has proposed legislation to establish the Canada Emergency Response Benefit (CERB).

entry.title: Government of Canada Announces Additional Measures to Support Continued Lending to Canadian Consumers and Businesses
entry.summary: Today, Minister of Finance Bill Morneau announced amendments to mortgage insurance eligibility criteria, set out in regulations made under the National Housing Act and Protection of Residential Mortgage or Hypothecary Insurance Act. These changes will help provide stable funding and liquidity to financial institutions and mortgage lenders and support continued lending to Canadian businesses and consumers.

entry.title: Canada outlines measures to support the economy and the financial sector
entry.summary: Today, Minister of Finance Bill Morneau, Governor of the Bank of Canada Stephen Poloz, and Superintendent of Financial Institutions Jeremy Rudin outlined a coordinated package of measures being taken by financial sector partners to support the functioning of markets and continued access to financing for Canadian businesses.

entry.title: Minister Fortier engages with Canadians in British Columbia on quality of life and well-being
entry.summary: As part of her mandate to better incorporate quality of life measurements into decision-making and budgeting, the Honourable Mona Fortier, Minister of Middle Class Prosperity and Associate Minister of Finance, successfully completed a tour of communities in British Columbia. She met with Canadians to better understand what quality of life and well-being mean to them, and to understand the key issues facing their communities.

entry.title: Minister Fortier discusses the importance of quality of life and well-being of Canadians in Victoria
entry.summary: In Victoria, the Minister participated in a roundtable with stakeholders, including Mayor Lisa Helps, to hear from them on what quality of life and well-being mean to them and their communities, and to understand the key issues they are facing. The Minister also highlighted the need to look at a broader range of evidence than standard economic statistics, such as gross domestic product (GDP), to assess progress in people’s quality of life and establish policy priorities.

entry.title: Minister Fortier discusses the importance of quality of life and well-being of Canadians in Surrey
entry.summary: In the context of a tour dedicated to listening to Canadians on what quality of life means to them, the Minister participated in a roundtable with stakeholders in Surrey to hear from them on what quality of life and well-being mean to them, and to understand the key issues facing their communities. The Minister also highlighted the need to look at a broader range of evidence than standard economic statistics, such as gross domestic product (GDP), to assess progress in people’s quality of life and establish policy priorities.

entry.title: Statement of G7 Finance Ministers and Central Bank Governors
entry.summary: We, G7 Finance Ministers and Central Bank Governors, are closely monitoring the spread of the coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) and its impact on markets and economic conditions.

entry.title: Department of Finance Canada releases annual report on federal tax expenditures
entry.summary: Today, the Department of Finance Canada released the 2020 Report on Federal Tax Expenditures—Concepts, Estimates and Evaluations. This report provides estimates of the fiscal cost of federal tax measures designed to keep the federal tax system functioning properly and support Canadian families and businesses.

entry.title: Minister Morneau attends G20 Meeting of Finance Ministers and Central Bank Governors
entry.summary: Finance Minister, Bill Morneau, will attend the G20 Meeting of Finance Ministers and Central Bank Governors in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, from February 22 to 23. At the meeting, the Minister will emphasize the importance of fair and open trade and encourage the G20 to continue its focus on creating economic growth that works for everyone. Minister Morneau will be joined by Bank of Canada Governor Stephen S. Poloz.

entry.title: Ministers Morneau and Fortier welcome FCAC reports on complaints handling and announce review
entry.summary: Today, Minister of Finance, Bill Morneau, and Minister of Middle Class Prosperity and Associate Minister of Finance, Mona Fortier, welcomed two reports from the Financial Consumer Agency of Canada (FCAC) on the complaints handling system in banking.

entry.title: Making life more affordable for Canadians
entry.summary: Today, Minister of Finance Bill Morneau released an updated analysis of the net impact of measures introduced since 2015 to make life more affordable for the middle class and people working hard to join it.

entry.title: Minister Morneau announces new benchmark rate for qualifying insured mortgages
entry.summary: Today, Minister of Finance, Bill Morneau, announced changes to the benchmark rate used to determine the minimum qualifying rate for insured mortgages, also known as the “stress test.” These changes will come into effect on April 6, 2020. The new benchmark rate will be the weekly median 5-year fixed insured mortgage rate from mortgage insurance applications, plus 2%.

entry.title: Parliamentary Secretary Fraser in Masstown, Nova Scotia, to talk about priorities for Budget 2020
entry.summary: Today, Parliamentary Secretary to the Minister of Finance and to the Minister of Middle Class Prosperity and Associate Minister of Finance, Sean Fraser, was in Masstown, Nova Scotia, to continue the Government of Canada’s consultations for Budget 2020. The Parliamentary Secretary joined the local Member of Parliament, Lenore Zann, for a roundtable discussion with local business and not-for-profit leaders to talk about investments to help grow the economy, create more good, well-paying jobs, and ensure everyone has a real and fair chance at success.

entry.title: Minister Fortier discusses middle class prosperity and Budget 2020 priorities in Toronto
entry.summary: Today, the Honourable Mona Fortier, Minister of Middle Class Prosperity and Associate Minister of Finance, was in Toronto to deliver a speech to le Club canadien de Toronto as part of its annual general assembly. The theme of the speech was prosperity among middle class Francophones. Following the speech, Minister Fortier participated in a question and answer session.

entry.title: Minister Morneau meets with private sector economists
entry.summary: Finance Minister Bill Morneau met today with Canada’s leading private sector economists to gather their evaluations on the state of the Canadian and global economies as well as their expectations for the months and years ahead.

entry.title: Minister Fortier meets with business and community leaders in Kenora to discuss Budget 2020 priorities
entry.summary: Today, the Honourable Mona Fortier, Minister of Middle Class Prosperity and Associate Minister of Finance, was in Kenora, Ontario, to continue the Government of Canada’s consultations for Budget 2020. Minister Fortier took part in a roundtable discussion to hear from business and community leaders and stakeholders from the region about how the government can help grow the middle class and the economy in a way that works for everyone.
